actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-224, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1668 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Any time after the adoption of this resolution the Speaker may declare the House reolved into the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union to consider the bill and specified amendments. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries now printed in the bill as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. In lieu of the amendments recommended by the Committees on Public Works and Transportation and Science, Space and Technology, it shall be in order to consider amendments offered by Representative Jones of North Carolina or his designee. Said amendme...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 50.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1668) to authorize appropriations for certain ocean and coastal programs of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R.1668 (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration funding).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1668) to authorize appropriations for certain ocean and coastal programs of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
